section.p: When your folder list is in Explorer-like tree view, you can create subfolders to each folder. You can then import documents into the subfolders like into any other folder. You can even create a subfolder for a subfolder.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Your folder list must be in Explorer-like tree view.

section.title: Calling sequence

ol.li: Double-click the folder for which you want to create a subfolder. The contents of this folder is displayed.
Click in the area containing the folder contents.
Click New on the File menu.

section.p: The Create a New Subfolder window (see ) is displayed. windowsCreate a New Subfolder Create a New Subfolder windowFigure shows Create a New Subfolder window

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: The options you specify are used for all documents imported into this folder. If individual documents need other properties, you can specify these when importing the documents.

plentry.pd: Contains the name of the folder or subfolder for which you are creating a subfolder.
Type up to 40 alphanumeric characters that describe the subfolder.
Displays the properties of the folder or subfolder for which you are creating a subfolder.
If your subfolder is to differ in one or more properties from its parent folder or subfolder, specify them in the appropriate fields.

section.p: Click Create to create the new subfolder. Click Cancel to leave this window without creating a new subfolder.

section.title: Results
section.p: If you clicked Create, the subfolder is created and added, in the tree view, as a subfolder to its parent folder.
